item.title: The ‚Äústay at home girlfriend‚Äù trend
item.description:
Lauren Chen on Twitter

‚ÄúTikTok is full of attractive, young women calling themselves ‚Äústay-at-home-girlfriends‚Äù They don‚Äôt go to work, and spend all day at home spending their boyfriends‚Äô money and doing household chores Predictably, feminists are furious about it. But is this trend such a bad thing?‚Äù

URL: https://twitter.com/TheLaurenChen/status/1610337205171388417

source: Wednesday assorted links

item.title: How much are Russian cyberattacks diminishing?
item.description:
Matthew Mittelsteadt on Twitter

‚ÄúRussian cyber attacks on Ukraine have dramatically dropped off since the start of the war. People rarely acknowledge that cyberweapons are not endless and renewing the supply is extremely difficult. Once you use your attacks, they are gone. Looks like Russia‚Äôs arsenal is emptying‚Äù

URL: https://twitter.com/MattInThemittel/status/1610659036516712450

Ethan Mollick on Twitter
